description.narrative: The purpose of the intervention is to contribute to the construction of a peaceful society with stable public institutions in 2023. To reach this global objective, the cooperation partner has identified the following three main axes of intervention : Axis 1: Strengthening constitutionalism, the rule of law and political and socioeconomic governance;Axis 2: Promoting civic awareness, social cohesion and good governance in the security sector;Axis 3: Institutional support and organizational strengthening of the CGD.

description.narrative: The results presented below are drawn from the narrative reports for 2019 (final version) and 2020 (draft version), as well from information provided during the steering committee meeting of February 2020. A central part of CGD's activities is the organization of democratic dialogues which consist of inviting various actors to debate on the most important issues in the area of ??good governance. These debates aim to make relevant recommendations to improve the democratic governance of society. This is an activity that usually gathers between 150 and 400 people. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, the government took steps to limit the spread of the virus which included on gatherings of more than fifty people. This made it impossible for the CGD to organize democratic dialogues as planned during 2020. Instead, they were organized in an alternative way through live TV broadcasts with the opportunity for viewers to call in to contribute or ask questions to the panellists. During 2020, five democratic dialogues were organized. The first democratic dialogue focused on the effects of covid-19 on the electoral process in Burkina Faso.The dialogue aroused great interest, attracted widespread attention and had the desired effects, as the president of Burkina Faso a few days later invited the majority and the opposition to a political dialogue on the issue. During 2020, CGD carried out several activities in the mining sector. These essentially focused on the citizen monitoring of the management of the mining development fund. Also, activities on the environmental and social impact of mining activities were carried out. These activities brought together local elected officials, women's and youth associations and other civil society organizations. In regards to the mining development fund, it can be noted that the advocacy conducted in 2019 with the mine chamber and the actions of the CGD in the field contributed to increasing the level of revenue collection for the fund. In fact, in the two intervention municipalities of Houndé and Yalgo, a significant increase in revenues from the mining fund for the benefit of the mining commune of Houndé has been noted, despite the fact that the mining company was initially reluctant to pay the fund. Another focus for CGD is strengthening the capacity of the national parliament. The recommendations of studies, advocacy meetings and technical support in terms of public policy and monitoring of these policies have contributed to the growth in capacity of Parliament in 2019 and 2020. In addition to its legislative production capacity, which has improved, there has been progress in parliament's efforts to monitor the implementation of policies and recommendations from parliamentary missions. This was made evident in the creation of a specific committee, CEPSUR (Commission d’évaluation des politiques et de suivi des recommandations). However the activities of the committee have been limited to following up on the recommendations of the parliamentary inquiry committees, and not as much the evaluation of public policies. CGD has undertaken workshops for the capacity strengthening of locally elected officials and civil society organisations on the subject of civic participation in three different municipalities. These workshops have facilitated the implementation of a framework for civic participation on basic social services and resource management between elected officials and CSOs . With these frameworks for participation, CGD is promoting an improvement in local governance through the culture of management rigor and accountability. This approach bore fruit at the end of 2019, when the first participation framework meetings were held. This exercise allows for increased opportunities for population of these communities to participate in the efficient and effective management of public services. Another core CGD activity is the organisation of university students in cells to strengthen their knowledge of democratic values. During 2020, the focus was partly on the upcoming election. Each student had to register to be able to vote in the election and presented their voting card on the common platform. Each enrolled student then had to in turn mobilize five other students or youth from their neighborhood to do the same. This strategy made it possible to register thousands of students and has really contributed to the high proportion of young people enrolled in the electoral roll.
